messages.subject: Re: Lego Software
messages.msgSnippet: Alex, Thank you for the quick reply.  I downloaded the software.  I can t say that it is user friendly, but I will play around with it some to see if I can
messages.messageBody:
Alex,

Thank you for the quick reply. I downloaded the software. I can't
say that it is user friendly, but I will play around with it some to
see if I can make better sense of it.

Best regards,
Anna

--- In AlwaysLearning@yahoogroups.com, BRIAN POLIKOWSKY
<polykowholsteins@...> wrote:
>
> Have you tried the Lego.com software that makes you build your own
stuff ?
> Its great. Its also free.
>

>
> the Lego Digital Designer
> on the right hand side.
>
>
>
> Alex Polikowsky
> http://polykow.blogspot.com/

> http://groups.yahoo.com/group/unschoolingmn/

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Lego Software
messages.msgSnippet: Have you tried the Lego.com software that makes you build your own stuff ? Its great. Its also free.  http://play.lego.com/en-US/Downloads/default.aspx the
messages.messageBody:
Have you tried the Lego.com software that makes you build your own stuff ?
Its great. Its also free.

 http://play.lego.com/en-US/Downloads/default.aspx

the Lego Digital Designer
on the right hand side.



Alex Polikowsky
http://polykow.blogspot.com/

http://groups.yahoo.com/group/unschoolingmn/
 



----- Original Message ----
From: hollywoodapi <anna@...>
To: AlwaysLearning@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Sunday, November 2, 2008 1:03:53 PM
Subject: [AlwaysLearning] Lego Software


Dear All,

We have a lot of loose Lego pieces & I was wondering if there is a
software that would give us directions or let us design our own
masterpieces & will guide us thru the steps.

Thank you,
Anna
Miami, Florida
